description.p: Many Paladins pledge themselves to gods. Very few pledge themselves to the elements or the world itself.
Environment First. Your actions should show those around you that the environment and the elements is of the utmost importance. You must attempt to do away with those who would destroy it.
Embody the Elements. Be as passionate as fire. As adaptable as water. As steadfast as stone. As free as the wind. As verbose as thunder. As quick as lightning.

Speak the Splendor. When possible, and when there are those willing to listen, teach them the wonders and splendors of the natural world. Before attempting to destroy those who would destroy it, teach them why it is worth protecting.
Restoration. In the case of environmental damage, heal and restore what is possible, when possible for you.

description.p: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following Channel Divinity options.

Return To Form. You can use your Channel Divinity to invoke the healing spirits of nature. As and action you cause a swath of infertile land up to a square mile in a cube, cursed or otherwise, to become healthy land where plants can grow. Plants show small signs of growing shortly after this takes effect.

Elemental Strike. You can use your Channel Divinity to invoke the wrath of the elements. When you make a melee attack roll you can use your Channel Divinity to deal an additional 4d6 damage, 1d6 of cold, fire, lightning, thunder.

description.p: Starting at 15th level, you age 1 year for every 10 years that pass and you can't be aged by magical means. There is also a slight cosmetic change that incorporates the elements.

description.p: At 20th level, You can use your action to undergo a transformation for 1 minute you gain the following benefits: You gain immunities to the damage types listed in aura of the elements. You gain a flying speed of 60ft. As a bonus action you choose 3 creatures that must make a charisma saving throw. On a failed save they take your paladin level of damage in one of the types of damage listed in your aura of the elements. on a successful save the damage is halved.
This effect ends early if you are incapacitated or die. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
